verses.text: And God spoke all these words, saying:
verses.comment: Sets the context for the Ten Commandments. Word-for-word, as in Masoretic Text.

verses.text: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.comment: Use of 'LORD' for YHWH. 'House of slavery' retains literal translation from Hebrew.

verses.text: You shall have no other gods before Me.
verses.comment: 'before Me' is literal; emphasizes exclusivity.

verses.text: You shall not make for yourself an idol, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above or on the earth beneath, or in the waters under the earth.
verses.comment: 'Idol' for 'graven image'; 'likeness' stays true to Hebrew 'temunah.'

verses.text: You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and the fourth generation of those who hate Me.
verses.comment: Retains language of 'jealous' and 'visiting the iniquity.'

verses.text: But showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
verses.comment: 'Steadfast love' for Hebrew 'chesed.' 'Thousands' retains ambiguity of Hebrew text.

verses.text: You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not leave unpunished anyone who takes His name in vain.
verses.comment: 'Leave unpunished' is a dynamic equivalent for Hebrew 'will not hold him guiltless.'

verses.text: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
verses.comment: Directly follows Hebrew syntax.

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the LORD your God. On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your livestock, nor the foreigner who is within your gates.
verses.comment: Retains the original order and distinctions. 'Foreigners within your gates' literal for 'sojourner.'

verses.text: For in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore the LORD blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.
verses.comment: Direct translation, keeps Trinitarian creation context.

verses.text: Honor your father and your mother, so that your days may be long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
verses.comment: 'Be long in the land' is literal; 'honor' for Hebrew 'kabed.'

verses.text: You shall not murder.
verses.comment: 'Murder' is the more accurate translation of Hebrew 'ratsach' than 'kill.'

verses.text: You shall not commit adultery.
verses.comment: Faithful to the original wording.

verses.text: You shall not steal.
verses.comment: Direct and accurate.

verses.text: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.comment: Literal translation.

verses.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male servant, or his female servant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.
verses.comment: 'Covet' accurate to Hebrew 'chamad.' List keeps original sequence.

verses.text: Now all the people saw the thunder and the lightning, the sound of the trumpet and the mountain smoking. And when the people saw it, they trembled and stood far off.
verses.comment: Description of Sinai events—keeps original sensory order.

verses.text: And they said to Moses, 'Speak with us, and we will listen. But do not let God speak with us, lest we die.'
verses.comment: Literal rendering of their plea.

verses.text: And Moses said to the people, 'Do not be afraid; for God has come to test you, that His fear may be before you, so that you may not sin.'
verses.comment: 'Fear may be before you' retains original Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: So the people stood far off, but Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
verses.comment: Keeps 'thick darkness' literal for Hebrew 'araphel.'

verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, 'Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: "You have seen that I have spoken to you from heaven."'
verses.comment: God reiterates His divine authority.

verses.text: You shall not make gods of silver to be with Me, nor shall you make gods of gold for yourselves.
verses.comment: Direct warning against idolatry.

verses.text: An altar of earth you shall make for Me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I cause My name to be remembered, I will come to you and bless you.
verses.comment: Instructions for altar and sacrifices.

verses.text: And if you make Me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stones; for if you use a tool on it, you have profaned it.
verses.comment: 'Profaned' is literal rendering—no use of tools means keeping altar sacred.

verses.text: And you shall not go up by steps to My altar, so that your nakedness may not be exposed on it.
verses.comment: Maintains the original concern about nakedness being exposed.
